VIII-B Proof of Theorem 2

Let Jt∗​(𝒉t,𝒃t)subscriptsuperscript𝐽𝑡subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒃𝑡J^{*}_{t}(\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{b}_{t}) denote the optimal objective value of the (T−t)𝑇𝑡(T-t)-stage problem that starts from state (𝒉t,𝒃t)subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒃𝑡(\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{b}_{t}) at time slot t𝑡t and ends at time slot T𝑇T, i.e.,

Jt∗​(𝒉t,𝒃t)=minπ⁡𝔼π​[∑i=tTAT−i​c​(𝒉i,𝒑i)|𝒉t,𝒃t],∀t.subscriptsuperscript𝐽𝑡subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒃𝑡subscript𝜋subscript𝔼𝜋delimited-[]conditionalsuperscriptsubscript𝑖𝑡𝑇superscript𝐴𝑇𝑖𝑐subscript𝒉𝑖subscript𝒑𝑖subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒃𝑡for-all𝑡\displaystyle J^{*}_{t}(\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{b}_{t})=\min_{\pi}\mathbb{E}_{\pi}\left[\sum_{i=t}^{T}A^{T-i}c(\boldsymbol{h}_{i},\boldsymbol{p}_{i})|\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{b}_{t}\right],\forall t. (64)

Then, we prove by induction that Jt∗​(𝒉t,𝒃t)subscriptsuperscript𝐽𝑡subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒃𝑡J^{*}_{t}(\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{b}_{t}) is equal to the value function Vt​(𝒉t,𝒃t)subscript𝑉𝑡subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒃𝑡V_{t}(\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{b}_{t}). It is obvious that JT∗​(𝒉T,𝒃T)=VT​(𝒉T,𝒃T)subscriptsuperscript𝐽𝑇subscript𝒉𝑇subscript𝒃𝑇subscript𝑉𝑇subscript𝒉𝑇subscript𝒃𝑇J^{*}_{T}(\boldsymbol{h}_{T},\boldsymbol{b}_{T})=V_{T}(\boldsymbol{h}_{T},\boldsymbol{b}_{T}) according to the definition of VT​(𝒉T,𝒃T)subscript𝑉𝑇subscript𝒉𝑇subscript𝒃𝑇V_{T}(\boldsymbol{h}_{T},\boldsymbol{b}_{T}) as shown in (27). VIII-D Proof of Theorem 4

According to [29, Theorem 4.7.5], to show that pn,t∗superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑛𝑡p_{n,t}^{*} is non-increasing in hn,tsubscriptℎ𝑛𝑡h_{n,t}, it suffices to verify that the following four conditions hold:

(2) ∑{𝒉t+1,𝒃t+1|hn,t+1≥h~}ℙ​(𝒉t+1,𝒃t+1|𝒉t,𝒃t,𝒑t)subscriptconditional-setsubscript𝒉𝑡1subscript𝒃𝑡1subscriptℎ𝑛𝑡1~ℎℙsubscript𝒉𝑡1conditionalsubscript𝒃𝑡1subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒃𝑡subscript𝒑𝑡\sum_{\left\{\boldsymbol{h}_{t+1},\boldsymbol{b}_{t+1}|{h}_{n,t+1}\geq\tilde{h}\right\}}\mathbb{P}(\boldsymbol{h}_{t+1},\boldsymbol{b}_{t+1}|\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{b}_{t},\boldsymbol{p}_{t}) is non-decreasing in hn,tsubscriptℎ𝑛𝑡h_{n,t}, for all h~∈ℋ~ℎℋ\tilde{h}\in\mathcal{H}.

(3) c​(𝒉t,𝒑t)𝑐subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒑𝑡c(\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{p}_{t}) is submodular in hn,tsubscriptℎ𝑛𝑡h_{n,t} and pn,tsubscript𝑝𝑛𝑡p_{n,t}.

(4) ∑{𝒉t+1,𝒃t+1|hn,t+1≥h~}ℙ​(𝒉t+1,𝒃t+1|𝒉t,𝒃t,𝒑t)subscriptconditional-setsubscript𝒉𝑡1subscript𝒃𝑡1subscriptℎ𝑛𝑡1~ℎℙsubscript𝒉𝑡1conditionalsubscript𝒃𝑡1subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒃𝑡subscript𝒑𝑡\sum_{\left\{\boldsymbol{h}_{t+1},\boldsymbol{b}_{t+1}|{h}_{n,t+1}\geq\tilde{h}\right\}}\mathbb{P}(\boldsymbol{h}_{t+1},\boldsymbol{b}_{t+1}|\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{b}_{t},\boldsymbol{p}_{t}) is submodular in hn,tsubscriptℎ𝑛𝑡h_{n,t} and pn,tsubscript𝑝𝑛𝑡p_{n,t}, for all h~∈ℋ~ℎℋ\tilde{h}\in\mathcal{H}.

Thus, condition (1) holds. Moreover, we have ∂2c​(𝒉t,𝒑t)∂hn,t​∂pn,t≤0superscript2𝑐subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒑𝑡subscriptℎ𝑛𝑡subscript𝑝𝑛𝑡0\frac{\partial^{2}c(\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{p}_{t})}{\partial h_{n,t}\partial p_{n,t}}\leq 0, which indicates that c​(𝒉t,𝒑t)𝑐subscript𝒉𝑡subscript𝒑𝑡c(\boldsymbol{h}_{t},\boldsymbol{p}_{t}) is a submodular function in hn,tsubscriptℎ𝑛𝑡h_{n,t} and pn,tsubscript𝑝𝑛𝑡p_{n,t}, and thus condition (3) holds.

STD​(|Ω¯t|)=(∑n=1Nℙ​(β¯n,t=1)​(1−ℙ​(β¯n,t=1))⏟≤1)12≤N.STDsubscript¯Ω𝑡superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑁subscript⏟ℙsubscript¯𝛽𝑛𝑡11ℙsubscript¯𝛽𝑛𝑡1absent112𝑁\displaystyle\textup{STD}(|\overline{\Omega}_{t}|)=\bigg{(}\sum_{n=1}^{N}\underbrace{\mathbb{P}(\overline{\beta}_{n,t}\!=\!1)(1\!-\!\mathbb{P}(\overline{\beta}_{n,t}\!=\!1))}_{\leq 1}\!\bigg{)}^{\!\frac{1}{2}}\!\leq\sqrt{\!N}. (70)

According to [38], we have that MAD​(X)≤STD​(X)MAD𝑋STD𝑋\textup{MAD}(X)\leq\textup{STD}(X) for arbitrary random variable X𝑋X. Then, combining (70) into (69), we have

J​(π~)−J​(π¯∗)≤η​ρ​T​N2​R​Dmin=η​ρ​T2​κ​Dmin​N.𝐽~𝜋𝐽superscript¯𝜋𝜂𝜌𝑇𝑁2𝑅subscript𝐷min𝜂𝜌𝑇2𝜅subscript𝐷min𝑁\displaystyle J(\tilde{\pi})-J(\overline{\pi}^{*})\leq\frac{\eta\rho T\sqrt{N}}{2RD_{\textup{min}}}=\frac{\eta\rho T}{2\kappa D_{\textup{min}}\sqrt{N}}. (71)

The expected cumulative cost under π¯∗superscript¯𝜋\overline{\pi}^{*} is a lower bound of the expected cumulative cost under the optimal policy π∗superscript𝜋\pi^{*}, since constraint C3¯¯C3\overline{\textup{C3}} is a relaxed version of constraint C3. Thus, we have

J​(π~)−J​(π∗)≤𝐽~𝜋𝐽superscript𝜋absent\displaystyle J(\tilde{\pi})-J(\pi^{*})\leq J​(π~)−J​(π¯∗)≤η​ρ​T2​κ​Dmin​N.𝐽~𝜋𝐽superscript¯𝜋𝜂𝜌𝑇2𝜅subscript𝐷min𝑁\displaystyle J(\tilde{\pi})-J(\overline{\pi}^{*})\leq\frac{\eta\rho T}{2\kappa D_{\textup{min}}\sqrt{N}}. (72)
